question.questiontext: A 32-year women scheduled for breast surgery refused to remove her jewellery. What will be the most appropriate action that must be taken by the nurse?

option.optiontext: Tell her this is hospital policy so you have to remove the jewellery
Explain her that jewellery is a source of infection so it may lead to postoperative infection

Warn
her that Surgeon will not operate until you remove your jewellery
Tell the client to provide written consent for the same and wrap the jewellery by adhesive tape

option.optiontext: Discard the solution as its validity has expired
Continue using solution as it is just over a month
Continue using solution as discarding is waste of money
Keep the solution for cleaning in minor procedures

question.questiontext: What is a Surgical Safety Checklist (SSC)?

A list of equipment that will be required during the surgery
A tool to ensure that all staff in the practice are prepared for an emergency
A document listing all the roles of staff members in the operating theatre

Unsterile sponge to be used for covering the stoma and removed after preparation

Unsterile sponge to be used for covering the stoma and not removed even after preparation

Grasp towel with edges and put it inside out on prepped area

question.questiontext: A urine specimen is needed to test for the presence of ketones in a client who is diabetic. What should the nurse do when collecting this specimen from a urinary retention catheter?

option.optiontext: Disconnect the catheter and drain the urine into a clean container.
Clean the drainage valve and remove the urine from the catheter bag.
Wipe the catheter with alcohol and drain the urine into a sterile test tube.
Clamp the catheter, cleanse the port, and use a sterile syringe to remove urine.

tag.tagname: Competency area: introduction to urinary catheterization
Competency Definition: urine specimens aseptically from a retention catheter using the sampling port

question.question_text: Perform the PIVC Pre procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Identifies the patient using two identifiers: Name and Hosp No
Checks order and reviews patient record for allergies and clinical alerts, explain purpose of the cannula and obtain consent
Collects and prepares required supplies, checking integrity of packaging and expiry dates
Palpates veins and selects appropriate site – related to location, size & condition of vein
Selects the appropriate cannula based on type & duration of procedure, and quality of site.

question.question_text: Perform the PIVC Main procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Positions patient’s arm on drape and pillow
Applies single-use tourniquet, palpates veins and selects appropriate site – related to location, size & condition of vein, releases tourniquet
Opens and assembles equipment using a non touch technique
Applies gloves. Uses sterile gloves if key parts or key sites may be touched during the procedure
Cleans site for 30 seconds with appropriate solution (e.g. 2% chlorhexidine/70% alcohol)
Anchors the vein below puncture site & insert cannula using non-touch technique
Checks for blood flashback.  If present, proceeds to lower the cannula to 0 degrees and advance the cannula  approximately 3 millimetres.
Occludes vein away from the cannula whilst retracting the stylet out of barrel
Disposes used sharp into an appropriate sharps container immediately
Attaches cannula cap and extension if required
Applies semi permeable  dressing, fixation device, Dates the dressing

question.question_text: Perform the PIVC Post procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Correctly disposes of equipment and sharps as per organisational policy
Records procedure in the patient’s medical record

question.question_text: Perform the procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hosp No
Gathered all equipment & donned non sterile gloves
Explained the procedure to the patient. Made patient upright
Examined nostrils for deformity/ obstructions to determine best side for insertion
Measured tubing from bridge of nose to ear lobe, then to the xiphisternum, and mark it
Lubricated 2-4inches of tube with lubricant (preferably 2% xylocaine)
Passed tube via either nare posteriorly, pass it through the pharynx into the oesophagus and then the stomach
Instructed the patient to swallow and advanced the tube as the patient swallows
Advanced tube until mark is reached
Checked for placement by attaching syringe to free end of the tube, aspirate sample of gastric contents. Secured tube with tape

Document the reason for the tube insertion, type & size of tube, the nature and amount of aspirate, the type of suction and pressure setting if for suction, the nature and amount of drainage and the effectiveness of the intervention

question.question_text: NG Tube FeedingPerform the procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hosp No
Washed hands thoroughly before touching the nasogastric tube. Assembled all articles near the bedside
Prepared and measured the prescribed amount of feed and water
Raised the head end of the patient or positioned the patient in high fowlers. Placed a tissue or towel over the patient’s chest
Checked for the tube placement. Fixed the 20cc/50cc syringe at the end of the feeding tube, while kinking it
Poured the measured quantity of the fed. Released the kink and slowly elevated the tube, to allow gravity flow
Kept adding more feed, as it continued to flow freely into the stomach. Once the measured feed is over, poured the measured quantity of water to flush the tube
Kinked the tube and closed it after removing the syringe
Recorded in the intake and out-put chart, the amount of feed and water with the time

question.question_text: Perform the procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hosp No
Explained the procedure to the patient to gain co-operation. Assembled the articles near the bedside
Provided privacy. Washed hands & put on sterile gloves
Cleaned the perineum using antiseptic lotion with forceps. One stroke from up to down with one gauze
Opened outer plastic cover of the catheter in such a way that inner cover is not contaminated and slide it into the catheterization pack
Instructed patient to take a deep breath and relax. Inserted the catheter about  5 to 7.5cms
If retention catheter is required, introduced sterile distilled water into inflate the balloon
Pulled the catheter slightly outward to ascertain stability
Connected the urobag for continuous urinary drainage and kept below the level of bladder
Checked the colour of the urine. Make the patient comfortable and replaced the equipment
Recorded the colour, amount and any abnormality of urine

question.question_text: Medication AdministrationPerform the procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hosp No
Assembled all equipment required for administration and Perform Hand Hygiene
Verified the medication using drug card
Selected the correct medication from shelf/ drawer and compared the label to the medication order on the drug card
Followed all the rights of medication administration
Select the appropriate site for IM, SC
Ask if the patient has a preferred injection site. If the patient is receiving regular IM/SC/ ID injections, ensure that the injection sites are rotated
Adequately expose the planned injection site for the procedure (e.g. deltoid)
Compared each medication again to the drug card after preparing medication on tray also before administering it.
Clean the site with chlorexidine 2% before inserting the needle.
Completed necessary assessments before giving medications
Signed medication card with date and time
Recorded fluid intake on the intake /output chart
Assess patient within 30 mts-1hour after giving medication

question.question_text: Perform the procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hosp No
Gathered all equipment, Perform hand hygiene
Check doctors order, date, time, flow, litre/min, & method
Explained the procedure to the patient. Make patient upright or semi fowler's position
Assess the patient response, check spo2

question.question_text: Perform the procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hosp No
Explained procedure to the patient and gathered necessary equipment.
Performed hand hygiene. Identified patient correctly.
Attached catheter to suction apparatus via connecting tube (make sure pressure is 80-120 mm Hg). Checked function.
Inserted catheter and applied intermittent suction (Time not to exceed 10-15 seconds).
Flushed and cleaned the catheter and suction tubing until clear.
Reassessed the patient’s respiratory status for expected and unexpected outcomes.
Documented need for suctioning and results in nurses notes.

question.question_text: Perform the procedure in the correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hosp No
Perform hand hygiene before and after specimen collection.
Explained the procedure to the patient, what  sample  to collect, how to collect, when to collect and amount
Provide the container and demonstrate how to use it.
Use aseptic technique in collection of all specimens.
Label specimens, tubes or bottles with all patient details.
Check for the correct specimen order is raised in HIS.
Transport the specimen immediately. And to ensure the sample is reached to lab.
Dispose of the articles and wash hands

question.question_text: Checking Vitals (temperature, pulse, respiration & blood pressure)Perform the procedure in the correct sequence

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hosp No
Explained the procedure and applied hand rub
Wiped the patient axilla with tissue paper. Switched on the digital thermometer and placed the thermometer in the axilla
Brought the arm across the patient to hold it firmly or held the thermometer by placing the patients hand in comfortable position
Waited for the beep, took the thermometer and noted the reading
Placed the first 3 fingers slightly over the radial artery & counted pulse for 1 minute
Counted the rise and fall of chest or upper abdomen for 1 minute to note the respiratory rate
Applied deflated cuff 2 inch above the anticubital fossa. Palpated for the brachial pulse and placed stethoscope over it
Pumped up air about 20mm of Hg above until the pulsation at the wrist disappears. Slowly opened valve and noted the reading where sound first began the systolic pressure
Continued to release the pressure slowly. Noted the point where the sound ceases, the diastolic pressure. Then allowed mercury to fall to zero
Replaced the articles and documented the temperature, pulse (type and  irregularities), respiration (rate and volume) and blood pressure

question.question_text: Checklists are in jumbled. Reorder the checklist in correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hospital No
Assembled all articles near the bedside, perform hand hygiene/place patient in supine/semi fowlers position
Explain the procedure and maintain the privacy
Demonstrate proper preparation of skin prior to placing the leads/ensure all jewels are removed.
Inputs data into ECG machine-Name/age/sex/hosp no

Apply adequate ECG jelly as below placement
Place the leads/Clamps
RA-right forearm or wrist
LA-left forearm  or wrist
LL-left lower leg, proximal to ankle
RL-right lower leg ,proximal to ankle
V1-4th intercostal space, right sternal edge
V2-4th  intercostal space, left sternal edge
V3-midway between V2 and V4
V4-5th intercostal space mid clavicular line
V5-anterior axillary line in straight line with V4 
V6-mid axillary line in straight line with V4 and V5
Ensure all the cables and leads are connected properly ,Obtain ECG ,take the print
Remove all cables and leads/clean the jelly
Ensure the patient is dressed properly and kept comfortably
Replace the articles and Wash hands

question.question_text: Checklists are in jumbled. Reorder the checklist in correct sequence.

option.optiontext: Check patient identification with name and Hospital No
Arrange all the articles needed, perform hand wash.
Explain the procedure and position the patient
Start to assess the GCS by check, Observe, Stimulate and Rate.

Check for Eye opening  :  E4
 Never -1 ( No opening at any time )
To Pain-2 ( After finger  tips/ orbital stimulus )
To Spech-3 ( After spoken or shouted request )
Spontaneously-4 ( Open before stimulus )

Best Verbal  Response : V5
None -1 ( No audible response )
Garbled-2 ( only moans/ groans )
Inappropriate -3 ( Intelligible single words )
Confused -4 ( Not oriented  but communication coherently)
Oriented -5 (  Name, place & Time )

Best Motor Response :  M6
None-1 (No movement in arms/ legs)
Extension-2 (Extends arm at elbow)
Abnormal flexion-3 (Bends arm at  elbow)
Withdrawal-4 (Bends arm at elbow rapidly)
Localizes  Pain-5 (brings hand above clavicle to stimulus head/ neck)
Obeys Command-6 (obeys to part request)
Assess the pupillary / Size / Reaction for Both eyes.
Document the GCS  (If any changes in GCS escalate )
